column4: I need to create an init script and to link it with a run level. Can anyone help?
I don't know how to do it
do you know how to write bash scripts?
Is a bash script something that ends with .sh?
as a convention .sh is not really bash per se, it is sh
I've got a .sh which I'd like to start as a daemon, that's my problem
paste the contents of the file where ubotu just told you to
if I run this script manually it works fine. I'd like this to start when Ubuntu starts
ok I just wanted to see if it was actually a daemon, first, move the file into /etc/init.d
ok I think there is some script which will do all the linking but I don't know its name, update-rc.d maybe, you will have to ask someone
